meanings.sent1: The begrimed windows made it hard to see outside.
meanings.sent2: The begrimed walls of the old house needed a good scrubbing.
meanings.sent3: The begrimed cat looked like it had been playing in the mud all day.
meanings.sent4: Her begrimed hands told the story of a hard day's work.
meanings.sent5: The begrimed chimney belched out black smoke into the sky.

meanings.definition: To make dirty with grime or soot.
meanings.sent1: The children begrimed their faces while playing in the backyard.
meanings.sent2: The old factory begrimed the once pristine river with pollution.
meanings.sent3: She accidentally begrimed her white shirt with grease from the bike chain.
meanings.sent4: The careless chef begrimed the kitchen with flour and sauce splatters.
meanings.sent5: The artist begrimed the canvas with charcoal to create a dramatic effect.
